Title: Santos, Tamboran Resources eye Darwin LNG expansion
Description: Australia-headquartered Tamboran Resources Corporation and Santos have inked a non-binding memorandum of understanding to undertake technical studies to potentially expand the 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG with a second train, utilising the resources co-owned by the firms in the Beetaloo Basin.
Author: JS

Title: NFE signs gas supply deal with Energiza in Puerto Rico
Description: LNG project developer New Fortress Energy has inked a 20-year gas supply agreement with Energiza to provide natural gas to a 478 MW combined-cycle power plant being developed in Puerto Rico, adjacent to NFE’s existing 1.1 mtpa San Juan LNG import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Technical issue takes Alexandroupolis LNG import terminal offline
Description: LNG terminal operator Gastrade has taken its 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating storage regasification unit-based import terminal in Greece offline due to a technical issue.
Author: CK

Title: Santos’ Barossa gas project nears final stages; on track for first LNG in third-quarter 2025
Description: Australian independent energy firm Santos’ Barossa gas project was 88.3% complete as of December and remains on track for first LNG production in  the third quarter of 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Snam commits about 90% of 12.4 billion euro strategic plan investment to gas, LNG projects
Description: Italy’s leading gas transport operator Snam will invest 12.4 billion euros under its 2025-2029 Strategic Plan, focusing 90% on gas and LNG infrastructure, and the rest on energy transition projects, building on initiatives launched in response to the energy crisis of the past two years and aiming to enhance energy security across Europe.
Author: CK
